chargeHist.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order

result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles Edward Reed Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Threat], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent with: Credit of 4 DAYS time served, concurrent to cases 21CM3791 and 22CF2105, and consecutive to case 21CF5185. THIS IS A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.
- Provide a DNA sample.

- Court WAIVES all non-mandatory costs, fees and surcharges.  Defendant to pay mandatory costs and surcharges (including DV and DNA) during period of probation on case 22CF2105.  If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.
- Court set restitution at $0.
- Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Charles Edward Reed Jr in court, in custody.  Attorney Martin Russell Tanz in court for Charles Edward Reed Jr.  Attorney Elaine B. Fehrs in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    

AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant ordered to serve 4 DAYS in the House of Correction, credit of 4 DAYS time served, concurrent to cases 21CM3791 and 22CF2105, and consecutive to case 21CF5185. THIS IS A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

- Provide a DNA sample.
- Court WAIVES all non-mandatory costs, fees and surcharges.  Defendant to pay mandatory costs and surcharges (including DV and DNA) during period of probation on case 22CF2105.  If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.
- Court set restitution at $0.

Court advised Defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.

Defendant Charles Edward Reed Jr in court, in custody.  Attorney Martin Russell Tanz in court for Charles Edward Reed Jr.  Attorney Elaine B. Fehrs in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Matter scheduled for Jury Trial.  Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank. 

AS TO COUNTS 2 AND 3: Pursuant to plea negotiations and on State's motion, Court orders charge dismissed but read-in for sentencing purposes.

Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
Documentation to be added to this case by defendant.  (Charles E. Reed - #2022006638, House of Correction, 8885 S 68th St, Franklin WI 53132).

Attorney Martin Russell Tanz in court, defendant Charles Edward Reed not in court, in custody.  Elaine B. Fehrs appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Matter scheduled for Plea and Sentencing hearing.  Defense counsel requests adjourned hearing date.  Court will leave case scheduled or Jury Trial date, but understand the case may resolve short of trial.  Case remains calendared for Jury Trial on 9/12/2022 at 9:00 am, Courthouse Room 501.

Received and Filed: Defendants Pro Se Notice and Motion for Bail Reduction.
RETURN ADDRESS: (CHARLES REED #2022006638 M6) MILWAUKEE COUNTY HOUSE OF CORRECTION, 8885 S 68TH ST FRANKLIN, WI 53432

Attorney Martin Russell Tanz in court, defendant Charles Edward Reed not in court, in custody.  Gerald Henry Alder appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Case previously scheduled for jury trial. Defense seeking global resolution. Court orders case adjourned for final pretrial/projected guilty plea.  Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Charles Edward Reed in court with attorney Martin Russell Tanz.  Elaine B. Fehrs appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for preliminary hearing. Preliminary hearing proceeded. Sworn for the State: Officer Levour Dawson (MPD). State rests. Defense rests. Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Original information received and filed; defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. Case is adjourned to Branch 35. Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Status conference scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.
